definition: Caltrop or puncture vine (Tribulus terrestris)/to thatch (a roof)
Carmen (name)/Carmen, 1875 opera by Georges Bizet 比才 based on novel by Prosper Mérimée 梅里美[Mei2 li3 mei3]
a dandy/a fop/Don Juan/a ladies man
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
Gounod (name)/Charles Gounod (1818-1893), French musician and opera composer
Modest Mussorgsky (1839-1881), Russian composer, composer of Pictures at an Exhibition
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Alexandr Sergeevich Pushkin (1799-1837), great Russian romantic poet
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
Prosper Mérimée (1803-1870), French scholar and writer, author of novel Carmen on which Bizet based his opera
Borodin (name)/Alexander Borodin (1833-1887), Russian chemist and composer
